page.title: 16Gunfield Hotel,Castle Rd.
page.content: The house was built in 1837,perhaps by French prisoners of war.There's still a cannon left on One Gun Point,and there is a great view of Kingswear,the mouth of the river and Dartmouth.If you go down a path,there is a little beach with soggy sand and a small stone hut for changing into swimming gear.Below the garden there is a new pontoon for mooring boats and a patio for barbecues.The owners bought the hotel 4 years ago and have done a lot of work on the building and grounds. There are 9 double bedrooms and 1 single,a dining-room with 9 tables and 36 chairs,2 bars,and a big lounge.It is a small friendly hotel and many of the guests are regulars who come for swimming,sailing,water-ski-ing,fishing the scenery and to relax.There are 12 staff,a chef&helper,washer-upper,iron- maiden,4 chamber-maids & 4 waitresses.
